page.title: 15THE A3(M) MOTORWAY
page.content: The motorway takes up about 14% of each grid square it passes through. It is part of a vital link between Portsmouth and London speeding up journeys for business transport especially. At 10.00a.m. on 22nd May 1985, I counted 107 cars, 17 lorries, 2 coaches and a minibus going southwards, during a 15 minute survey. Travelling north were 67 cars, 17 lorries, 1 community bus and a motor bike. The lorries carried timber, sand, metal containers, scrap metal, fruit and vegetables, sports equipment and double glazing. There were three unmarked lorries and a removal van. Building materials made up the highest proportion of goods carried, about 36%. 62% of the traffic was southbound and 38% northbound. The survey was conducted from Horndean Hill bridge.
